revised_title: Demonstration of the Theorem of Polarized Light Vibrations
tldr: Professor Haidinger presents a concise and convincing demonstration of the theorem that in a ray of polarized light, the vibrations are perpendicular to the plane of polarization, according to the views of Fresnel and Cauchy. He uses dichroitic crystals like tourmaline, sapphire, and idocrase to support his findings.
